record.text: Strong agree. The gap between 'AI-assisted but well-architected' and 'AI-generated spaghetti' is going to be massive. The tooling that enforces good patterns while still giving speed wins is where the real opportunity is.
This is the most accurate description of working with AI agents I've seen. You're not writing code, you're a helmsman steering through latent space. Rename your job title immediately.

The personality difference between coding agents is real and underappreciated. It's like choosing between a coworker who asks before touching your code vs one who rewrites your entire file. Both valid, very different vibes.

NASA’s SPHEREx Watches an Interstellar Comet Come Alive After Its Solar Encounter

A Rare Visitor From Beyond Our Solar System In late 2025, NASA’s SPHEREx space telescope captured a rare and scientifically valuable event: the dramatic awakening of an interstellar comet as it passed through our…

external.description: A Rare Visitor From Beyond Our Solar System In late 2025, NASA’s SPHEREx space telescope captured a rare and scientifically valuable event: the dramatic awakening of an interstellar comet as it passed through our solar system. Known as 3I/ATLAS, this object is only the third confirmed interstellar comet ever observed, making every new data point crucial. As SPHEREx turned its infrared instruments toward the comet, scientists were able to observe not just its motion, but its chemistry, activity, and transformation after its close approach to the Sun.
external.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Watches an Interstellar Comet Come Alive After Its Solar Encounter

I wanted to like opencode, but it seems too targeted towards people who like agents to run with minimal human intervention. Too much of an effort to craft an instruction to make it behave like claude code.

e.g. it didn't ask for approval for a git commit, and wrote a really terse message.

Coding harness personality is an extremely subjective preference. I have used Claude Code, Cursor, opencode, and github copilot cli. And I have found Github copilot cli to be the closest in personality to Claude Code.
Even the screenshot extension in chrome was like "This is too long, got to have three parts"

I wonder when Microsoft will rename Security Copilot. 

The name makes no sense given its expanded role across tons of non-security services. 

Maybe IT Copilot…

The thing I'm hung up on is how it's a reliable store of value in the longer term. A big part of why the USD has value (under MMT) is that we pay taxes in USD.

Bitcoin's also deflationary. How does a population grow and still ensure access to it as a store of value?

What is it for?

So, instead, I've convinced Copilot on my school's M365 tenant that it's a maned malwarewolf, and I feed it compiler errors.

I still have zero idea what to do with Bitcoin though.

The silliest part is that I'm often not against this shit. I just don't know what to do with it.

Like, what do I do with Bitcoin? What do I do with generative AI? I literally have no idea, and no one boosting the technology will tell me.
Copilot Cliff.

Microsoft’s Deal to Provide Computing to OpenAI Raises Alarms – Bloomberg https://blog.quintarelli.it/2026/02/microsofts-deal-to-provide-computing-to-openai-raises-alarms-bloomberg/

external.description:
Azure va benissimo… Quasi metà degli ordini futuri è da openAI che è solida come una roccia.

Oh yes.

The times they’re a-chaingin‘

> Last Wednesday, OpenAI became something new for its biggest investor: a liability.
>
> On Microsoft’s earnings call, Jefferies analyst Brent Thill pointed to OpenAI’s 45% share of Microsoft’s backlog of future sales. “There’s obviously concern about the durability,” said Thill, a longtime Microsoft watcher. “And I know maybe there’s not much you can say on this, but I think everyone is concerned about the exposure.”
>
> Exposure. As in, to the flu, tariffs or subprime mortgages.
>
> I’ve covered roughly 100 of these calls, where analysts tend to lob softballs or try to pry out a wonky financial detail. Listening to this question, relaying blunt feedback that challenged a core premise of the AI boom — that OpenAI will pay off — felt like hearing the world change.

Source: _Microsoft’s Deal to Provide Computing to OpenAI Raises Alarms – Bloomberg_

If you like this post, please consider sharing it.
external.title: Microsoft’s Deal to Provide Computing to OpenAI Raises Alarms – Bloomberg

record.text: False identità create con l’intelligenza artificiale: truffa all’Inps – Avvenire https://blog.quintarelli.it/2026/02/false-identita-create-con-lintelligenza-artificiale-truffa-allinps-avvenire/

external.description:
In questa notizia, per “bucare” manca scrivere che “successivamente avrebbero creato false identità SPID” e quindi titolare “Nuova truffa con SPID all’INPS”.

In realtà non hanno fatto identità SPID perchè…

una catena è forte tanto quanto il suo anello più debole.
– il processo di rilascio di una credenziale SPID prevede registrazione audio/video del richiedente e della sua voce, del suo indirizzo IP, del numero di telefono, prerequisito un documento precedente ed il codice fiscale, controlli successivi vari (per questo non c’è rilascio in tempo reale). Alternativamente si può usare una CIE o una firma digitale che siano state rilasciate identificando la persona (ovviamente si deve dare fiducia che la CIE/firma digitale non sia stata rilasciata con frode (vedi il punto sotto)).
– il processo di rilascio di una CIE prevede la possibilità di non esibizione di documenti precedenti ma solo di due testimoni, nessuna registrazione dell’evento.
– in entrambi i casi la fornitura delle credenziali all’interessato avviene da parte di funzionari di aziende private (servizi postali e identity provider) che operano con la qualifica di incaricati di pubblico servizio.

(dalle mie “FAQ su SPID” alla voce “SPID è meno sicuro della Carta d’identità elettronica (CIE)?”)

> Identità create con l’ausilio dell’IA. Così un dipendente comunale e i suoi due complici avrebbero incassato indebitamente le somme, pari a circa 1,4 milioni di euro, dell’assegno unico universale «in nome e per conto» di 59 donne di nazionalità romena, tutte con 5/6 figli a carico, tutte inesistenti. La presunta truffa, commessa tra il nord barese e la provincia di Foggia, è stata scoperta dalla guardia di finanza, che ha eseguito un sequestro preventivo di urgenza, già convalidato dal Tribunale di Foggia, nei confronti di due persone residenti nel Foggiano, accusate di truffa aggravata in concorso ai danni dello Stato. Sono indagate altre due persone, il dipendente dell’anagrafe di un Comune del nord barese e il dipendente di un caf di Foggia, non destinatari del provvedimento cautelare.

Source: _False identità create con l’intelligenza artificiale: truffa all’Inps_

If you like this post, please consider sharing it.
external.title: False identità create con l’intelligenza artificiale: truffa all’Inps – Avvenire

value.text:
Guess this paper (my undergraduate research) pre-dates this site so I've never shared the little comic abstract I made for Twitter here. 

Wasn't easy figuring out how I'd explain a six-hypothesis framework in one image!

images.alt:
Four-panel comic imagining a conversation between two beige and brown birds with yellow wing patches, clearly designed as shapes in powerpoint by someone who is not particularly talented at digital art. They are supposed to be Grasshopper Sparrows; I'll call the bird on the left Bird 1 and the bird on the right Bird 2. 

In the first panel, Bird 1 is in flight and Bird 2 is perched on a stick. Bird 1 says "I'm looking for a summer home!" Bird 2 responds "Join us here!" and Bird 1 asks "why would I want to join hundreds of competing Grasshopper Sparrow males?" 

In the second panel Bird 2, still on the wing, asks "Will you protect me from snakes?" and Bird 1 says "Nope." Then, "Will you keep cowbirds from laying eggs in my nest?" and "Won't even try." Then "Will you help me raise my nestlings?" and "Absolutely not." 

In the third panel, Bird 1, still on the wing, asks 'Will I find extra mates" and Bird 2 responds "nah, just the one." Then "Do my brothers live nearby? Will I raise my nieces and nephews?" and an asterisk leads the reader to a clarification that says "Females mate with other males--being near brothers could mean she mates with them, so the male would still be raising family members." Bird 2 responds "No." Bird 1 askes "Will my nest be more successful?" and Bird 2 says "Not consistently."

In the final panel Bird 2 narrates the conclusion of the paper: "So why do we sparrows form big groups of males? Maybe doing so... helps our young once they leave the nest...used to be a good breeding strategy, but changing environments mean it is no longer helpful...doesn't hurt us, so why not?" The comic ends with the words "Check out this scientific research in the journal Ecology!" and it has a reference to the paper "Social interactions do not drive territory aggregation in a grassland songbird" published in Ecology in 2019 by SK Winnicki, Stephanie Munguia, Emily Williams, and Alice Boyle.

record.text:
The issue: AI-generated code increases review time and Cognitive Load. SmartBear research shows we can review 200-400 lines effectively in one sitting (30-60 min)—assuming we know the system.

Claude Code or Copilot generating 1000 lines in 20 min? We can't review it properly.

GenAI is making code generation easier, but at what cost?

We're generating more code AND more technical debt. When we 10x code volume but 20x defects, we're not winning—we're compounding problems.

external.description: В условията на ожесточена конкуренция от страна на компании като Google и Anthropic, OpenAI даде пълен приоритет на развитието на ChatGPT за сметка на дългосрочните изследвания и експерименти, което доведе до напускането на някои висококвалифицирани служители. Сред тях са вицепрезидентът по изследванията Джери Туорек, изследователят по политическо моделиране Андреа Валоне и икономистът Том Кънингам. Според настоящи и бивши служители компанията е пренасочила ресурсите си от експериментална работа към разработване на големи езикови модели, които са в основата на нейния водещ чатбот. Под ръководството на главния изпълнителен директор Сам Алтман компанията се превърна от изследователска лаборатория в една от най-големите компании в Силициевата долина.
external.title: OpenAI ще се концентрира изцяло върху подобряването на ChatGPT – и заради това загуби много от водещите си разработчици на AI

Google Gemini ще се научи как да управлява смартфон – нова функция вече е разкрита в кода

Възможностите на съвременните ИИ-модели непрекъснато се разширяват и в обозримо бъдеще ИИ ще започне да контролира мобилните устройства. Google разработва тези възможности като част от програмата Project…

external.description: Възможностите на съвременните ИИ-модели непрекъснато се разширяват и в обозримо бъдеще ИИ ще започне да контролира мобилните устройства. Google разработва тези възможности като част от програмата Project Astra и това скоро може да даде първите осезаеми плодове. В бета-версия 17.4.66 на приложението Google, Android Authority откри препратки към тази функция и евентуалното ѝ име. Кодовото ѝ име е bonobo, но официалното име вероятно ще бъде „screen automatization“ (автоматизация на екрана). Може да се използва за правене на поръчки в онлайн магазини и поръчка на таксита. Вградената връзка в момента води към общата страница за поддръжка на Gemini, което означава, че е просто заместител.
external.title: Google Gemini ще се научи как да управлява смартфон – нова функция вече е разкрита в кода

Summary
CAE offers a compelling re-entry point after a 10% pullback, with 23% upside to 2027 price target.

📢【Thunder 3】bekommt eine Anime-Adaption! ✨️

📅 Geplanter Start 》Juli 2026
✨ Genre 》Mystery, Sci-Fi, Supernatural
🎬 Studio 》TBA

Mehr Details im Bildtext.

#Thunder3 #サンダー3 #YuukiIkeda #Anime #July2026 #Kodansha

images.alt:
🎙️ Charaktere & Cast (Japanisch)
»Pyontaro« von Sayumi Suzushiro
»Tsubame« von Natsumi Kawaida
»Hiroshi« von Eri Akiyama
»Futaba« von Honoka Mitsubachi

Mit einem Visual und Teaser Trailer wurde heute bekannt geben, dass der Mystery Manga »Thunder 3« von Yuuki Ikeda eine Anime-Adaption erhält. Die Anime-Adaption startet im Juli 2026 im japanischen TV. Zudem stellte man den japanischen Sprechercast offiziell vor.

»Thunder 3« erscheint seit Mai 2022 im Monthly Shonen Magazine von Kodansha und umfasst bislang 8 Bände. Nach einer Pause seit März 2025, kehrt die Reihe am 6. Februar ins Monthly Shonen Magazine von Kodansha zurück. Eine englische Übersetzung gibt es bei Kodansha US, aktuell sind dort 5 Bände verfügbar.

📜 Beschreibung 》
Drei alltagliche Schuljungen kommen an eine mysteriöse DVD, von der es heißt, sie könne ein Tor zu einer Parallelwelt offnen. Zunachst klingt das wie ein verruckter Mythos, doch dann passiert das Unfassbare. Pyontaros kleine Schwester Futaba gerat durch das Portal auf die andere Seite und wird sofort von Aliens verschleppt, die diese Version der Erde beherrschen. Die Jungen haben keine Wahl und setzen alles daran, ihr zu folgen. In der Parallelwelt treffen sie auf eine hyperrealistische Umgebung voller Gefahr und Chaos. Dabei entdecken sie etwas Unerwartetes: Ihre eigenen cartoonhaften Korper machen sie dort zu regelrechten Supermenschen. Mit neuen Kräften und viel Improvisation stellen sie sich der Alien Bedrohung. Ihre Mission ist klar: Futaba retten, bevor es zu spat ist. Zwischen Action, Wahnsinn und Parallelwelt Logik beginnt ein Rettungsabenteuer, das ihre Grenzen komplett sprengt.

external.description: Yes, Netflix has placed (or recategorized) Michelle Obama's 2020 documentary *Becoming* in a way that it appears in the Kids/Children's section, at least in the U.S. as of early February 2026.  Recent reports and widespread social media discussion indicate that the film was moved or added to the Kids category, where it ranked as high as #4 in the U.S. Kids Top 10. This change occurred around the time it was surging back into the general (adult/main) Top 10 Movies list—re-entering at #8 and climbing to #6—prompting speculation that the recategorization affected its visibility in adult rankings.  Key points from coverage: It remains searchable and accessible in adult/documentary categories (e.g., listed under Documentary Films, Biographical Documentaries, etc., with a PG rating). The shift to Kids appears to have removed or reduced its prominence in the standard adult Top 10 dashboard. This sparked backlash, confusion, and claims of deliberate manipulation (some tying it to comparisons with other political documentaries like one on Melania Trump). Sources like Newsweek reported user outrage over its appearance in the kids section, noting it was recategorized as a "Kids film." Netflix's official page describes it as a documentary (genres: Documentary Films, Biographical Documentaries, Social & Cultural Docs), but top charts can involve separate ranking logic, and titles can rank in multiple categories if deemed suitable (it's PG-rated and inspirational, so potentially eligible for family/kids viewing).  The change seems real and recent (surfacing prominently in late January/early February 2026 amid renewed popularity), though Netflix hasn't publicly explained it as a permanent "move" from Documentary—more like an addition or algorithmic shift affecting charts. Some users called it a glitch or error, while others saw intent.  For the latest status, check Netflix directly, as category and ranking placements can fluctuate.
external.title: Did Netflix move Michelle Obama’s Documentary “Becoming” into the Childrens Category from the Documentary section?

record.text:
I find that adopting an adversarial relationship with a subject matter ultimately achieves deeper understanding than simply relying solely on the surface level descriptions.

It ends up breaking black boxes open, illuminates HOW and WHY something works, and not just WHAT it's supposed to do.

This learning style can throw folks off (as it did in a discussion of FCC rules) as they think I'm trying to throw them off with hypothetical questions, where I'm really probing the boundaries and limits of something.

There's an element of "you don't know something until it breaks" that I *need*.
